articles.title: Burundian President Hopes for Peaceful Reunification of Korea
Appeal of Swiss and Sri Lankan Organizations Supported in India
articles.content:
Burundian President Hopes for Peaceful Reunification of Korea 
   Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- I hope that Korea will be reunified peacefully at an early date and all the problems settled in conformity with the desire of the Korean people, Burundian President Pierre Nkurunziza said when he received credentials from Pak Hyon Jae, DPRK ambassador to Burundi, on October 26.
 He expressed belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would continue to grow stronger and develop in the future, too.

articles.title: Japanese Reactionaries' Moves to Cover up "Comfort Women" Issue under Fire
articles.content:
Appeal of Swiss and Sri Lankan Organizations Supported in India 
   New Delhi, November 4 (KCNA) -- The Asian Regional Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification, the All-Indian Korean Friendship Association and the Indian Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification on Nov. 1 issued a joint statement in response to the appeals of organizations in Switzerland and Sri Lanka calling for having joint and significant commemorations of the greatest holidays of the Korean people next year and holding a meeting of organizations in the Asia-Pacific region for Korea's reunification and peace in Pyongyang. 
 The statement noted that the Indian National Preparatory Committee would be formed to commemorate the Day of the Sun and February 16 in 2007, colorful functions organized from Nov. 2006 to Apr. 2007 and a delegation sent to the DPRK to visit the old home of leader Kim Jong Il in the secret camp in Mt. Paektu.    
 It said the above-said organizations would make a contribution to the proposed meeting and strive to boost the friendly and cooperative relations between India and the DPRK.

Chairman of Chongryon Central Standing Committee Meets Chairman of Pro-Reunification Body in S. Korea 
   Tokyo, November 4 (KNS-KCNA) -- So Man Sul, chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), on Oct. 30 met and had a talk with Paek Rak Chong, chairman of the South Side's Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration and his party when he visited the Korean Hall in Tokyo. 
 On hand were Ri Ki Sok, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon, and Pak Ku Ho, director of the Department of the Movement for Reunification of the same.
